channel.title: they just changed too much...
channel.description:
i've been waiting for this mod for a while, believe me i want to enjoy it, but they changed way too much with this.
environment the most obvious change anyone will notice is the added in or modified areas in the mod, it wouldn't be so bad if it was just small changes to areas once in a while but they threw in entire new chunks to maps every ware just to do it. i wanted to play through the definitive edition of black mesa, not a re-imagining and the worst part is nobody asked for this and level design time could have been spent on other things like death match or maybe even decay co-op, and now they are completely re-doing xen to be even longer which than causes canon issues with opposing force since it was only a short time after going to xen that Gordon beat the aliens and than the full force of species x started pouring in. so many of the changes were unnecessary and could have been used for other stuff.
weapons and combat I've only been able to play briefly(ridiculous load times) but i cant believe the combat changes that I'm seeing, number one the zombie combat, now with the new way it attacks its almost impossible to melee without getting hit and it doesn't resemble original zombies OR HL2 zombies, same goes for the dog....thing you know what I'm talking about, its combat reaction is way to fast. and even the barnacles which should be a simple one hit have been changed to be harder to melee. With all of these issues the crowbar is now almost completely useless, you don't #$%# with the crowbar! and the pistol, shoots way to fast probably because they Nerf'd the bullet count, every time i shoot that thing it feels like I'm going "kill it! kill it with fire! kill it!"
change can be good, but this much change in the maps AND combat is ridiculous, i honestly cant recommend this game to friends for a half-life experience and will probably tell them to get the original and HD pack. hopefully operation black mesa and guard duty stay true to their core

item.title: they just changed too much...
item.dc:creator: Malidictus
item.description:
Dotard:

Half-Life with better graphics already exists, it’s called Half-Life: Source.

Would that that had better graphics. Half-Life: Source is just as dated as the original, except it has ragdolls and the cliff face has a very rushed 3D backdrop instead of a 2D one. Truth be told, I’d rather play Half-Life over Source, because at least for that I can use the Blue Shift high-rez weapons pack.

As for changes, I really don’t mind Black Mesa not being a perfect copy of Half-Life. It’s not the same game, after all. And indeed, the changes are outright better in a lot of places. The trouble is that the Black Mesa team clearly didn’t like everything in Half-Life, and a lot of the things they “fixed” I actually really enjoyed. On a rail, for instance, has been cut down to no more than half its length, with most of the non-train sections outright removed. Surface Tension has, similarly, been cut down drastically. There was supposed to be a whole other building in-between Barney letting you into the weapons store room and getting to the cannon to blow up the gate. That’s gone completely.

I wouldn’t go as far as to badmouth Black Mesa for it, but it really is considerably shorter than the original Half-Life because it simply misses large chunks of level in many, many places. As well, a LOT of the platforming segments that still exist have been bypassed almost entirely. Residue Processing is the most obvious. There’s no more jumping on floating meat chunks, the pistons room has partially-collapsed catwalks that provide static rest stops between piston jumps and the mixer tank no longer requires you to jump from mixer to mixer, because there’s a path which leads to the forward mixer and right out to the next room.

And for not being a carbon copy of Half-Life, Black Mesa still has sections that ARE carbon-copies of Half-Life locations. The main chamber in Blast Pit is a perfect recreation, right down to where the grating on the floor is, where it’s broken and even the hidden area that you have to be pulled up into by a barnacle creature. There’s also a spot in Questionable Ethics - climbing a set of stairs - that’s one-to-one exact with Half-Life, right down to the enemy spawn points, and those are non-talking enemies.

If anything, I wish Black Mesa were longer, and I’m not just referring to Xen. I want more “On a Rail” and more “Surface Tension” and more "Residue Processing and so forth. I can see the need to cut them down as a Source engine game takes a LOT longer to make levels for than an old Half-Life style 1990s FPS, so I’m not holding them to task… But I miss the chunks that aren’t there.

item.dc:creator: etb513
item.description:
On the contrary, I actually expected things to be changed a bit more than this. I immediately recognize everything from the original, but there’s just enough originality to keep it fresh and entertaining.

Regarding gameplay, yes there are some changes, but some of the things you’ve stated are just incorrect. It’s very easy to melee zombies without getting hit back, even on hard mode. Try again. Barnacles were never one hit kills in the original either (perhaps they were on easy mode, but I’ve never played that). The crowbar is perfectly effective against zombies and headcrabs. Even vortigaunts die to the crowbar very fast, if you somehow get too close.

Also Blue Shift and Opposing Force are not technically considered 100% canon, they are allowed to be retconned, though they are referenced. https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Half-Life_Wiki:Canon

Given how invalid most of these complaints are, I almost have to assume this is just a trolling attempt.
